ecs

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • ecs.Entity

  • public class Entity
extends Object
    The Entity class describes an Entity used by Engine and System. An Entity is like a powerful bag of as many Component as you want.
    Author:
    Alexis SKRZYNSKI (alexis.skrzynski@viacesi.fr) aka NeoDarkFire
    See Also:
    Component, Engine, System

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Entity()
      Default constructor.
      Entity(Collection<Component> comps)
      Creates an Entity with a Collection of Components.
      Entity(Component... comps)
      Creates an Entity with one to many Components.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Example : "Entity #1"
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Gets the unique ID identifying the Entity.
        Returns:
        The ID of the Entity.

      • destroy

        public <C extends Component> void destroy()
        Destroys the Entity. If the Entity has components, destroy them. If the Entity is registered to an Engine, tells it to discard the Entity.
        Type Parameters:
        C - A Component Class.

      • attach

        public Component attach(Component comp)
        Attach a Component to the Entity. If there is already a Component for that Component class, detach it.
        Parameters:
        comp - A Component.
        Returns:
        The old Component, when applicable.
        See Also:
        detach

      • attach

        public void attach(Component... comps)
        Attach one to many Component to the Entity. If there is already a Component for a Component class, detach it.
        Parameters:
        comps - Components.
        See Also:
        detach

      • attach

        public void attach(Collection<Component> comps)
        Attach a Collection of Component to the Entity. If there is already a Component for a Component class, detach it.
        Parameters:
        comps - A Collection of Component.
        See Also:
        detach

      • detach

        public Component detach(Class<? extends Component> compClass)
        Detaches a Component from the Entity.
        Parameters:
        compClass - The class of the Component to detach.
        Returns:
        the old Component.

      • detach

        @SafeVarargs
public final <C extends Component> void detach(Class<C>... compClasses)
        Detaches one to many Component from the Entity.
        Type Parameters:
        C - A Component Class.
        Parameters:
        compClasses - The classes of the Components to detach.

      • detach

        public <C extends Component> void detach(Collection<Class<C>> compClasses)
        Detaches a Collection of Component from the Entity.
        Type Parameters:
        C - A Component Class.
        Parameters:
        compClasses - A Collection of the class of the Components to detach.

      • has

        public boolean has(Class<? extends Component> compClass)
        Get whether if the Entity has a specified Component.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Get whether if the Entity has multiple specified Components.
        Parameters:
        compClasses - A Collection of Component classes.
        Returns:
        True if the Entity has all the Components.
